title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 1998/89 of 5 July 1989 re-establishing the levying of customs duties on clocks with watch movements, falling within CN code 9103, originating in China, to which the preferential tariff arrangements set out in Council Regulation (EEC) No 4257/88 apply
header:
COMMISSION  REGULATION (EEC) No 1998/89
of 5 July 1989
re-establishing the levying of customs duties on clocks with watch movements, falling within CN code 9103, originating in China, to which the preferential tariff arrangements set out in Council Regulation (EEC) No 4257/88 apply
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
As from 9 July 1989, the levying of customs duties suspended pursuant to Regulation (EEC) No 4257/88, shall be re-established on imports into the Community of the following products originating in China:
1.2.3 //  //  //  // Order No  // CN code   // Description  //  //  //  // 10.1170   // 9103   // Clocks with watch movements.   //    //   //

This Regulation shall enter into force on the third day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 5 July 1989.
For the Commission
Christiane SCRIVENER
Member of the Commission
(1) OJ No L 375, 31. 12. 1988, p. 1.
